title.narrative: Colombian NAMA for the domestic refrigeration sector

description.narrative: The NAMA Support Project supports a national ban of hydrofluorocarbons (HFC); the application of Minimum Efficiency Standards in the refrigeration sector; a production line conversion with hydrocarbon refrigerants instead of HFC & energy-efficient product design; a replacement programme including a sustainable on-bill financing mechanism with incentives for low-income households for returning old inefficient appliances; implementation of a sustainable extended producer responsibility scheme. The approach can be replicated in Latin America and other refrigeration and air-conditioning subsectors. The phase-in of new fridges and the proper waste management result in greenhouse gas emission reductions of 16.8 MtCO2e over the equipment lifetime & 50% reduction from BAU in the sector. Co-benefits include increased education, employment and economic competitiveness, improved access to credit and efficient equipment for low income households, & decreased negative environmental impacts.
